job_title: Teaching Assistant in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Professional. Flexible. Caring. Punctual. Great environment.
cons: No big or great negatives experienced.

job_title: English Teacher in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
+Professional development is very good 
+Colleagues were mostly friendly 
+Good pay rate 
+Students are great 
+Heavy emphasis on SEN
cons:
-Very, very institutionalised, to the point where sometimes I felt the work environment was full of corporate robots 
-Admin work can get overwhelming and frustrating with the amount of checklists and micro-management 
-Existing lesson materials are a mixed bag some are good and some are not up to scratch at all 
-Senior leadership do not fully understand issues front-line teachers have and take very long to implement solutions / changes 
-HR are highly inefficient with a lack of communication and clarity on local policies

review_title: Good values but doesn’t reward long term staff
job_title: Academic Coordinator in Hanoi
pros: Encourages professional development, professional, has guidelines and procedures that are based on international protocol. Reasonable pay and health insurance. Tries to adhere to its diversity commitments.
cons: Pay doesn’t increase after a certain band. Pay isn’t adjusted for inflation and hasn’t been for 15 years. Post Covid cuts mean more work allocated to existing staff with no extra increments

job_title: Teaching Assistant in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: Happy to work with students and teachers
cons: The environment is not healthy

review_title: Their policy does NOT let managers give Reference letter that mentions your job title or anything about British Council.
job_title: Business Development Manager in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
- Professional corporate culture
- Good insurance: medical insurance, health benefit and covid-19 vaccination 
- Good reputation: an organisation receiving funds from the UK government to promote the relationship between the British and the rest of the world.
- Most colleagues are nice
- Quite good office
- Seems to make an effort on EDI.
cons:
- Cannot use my name of choice for my email and company account. 
- MacBook users are not welcomed. Various systems only require access from their own devices, which are Windows laptops. Their excuses are cybersecurity. 
- It's a British public body so it's highly bureaucratic. 
- Main reason I left: overworked staff are unhappy staff. Even when we work extra hours (at night and on our holidays), there is still more work to be done, we constantly feel behind the job. The salary is no longer fair if counting the extra hours of work. My colleagues are dangerously exhausted for too long. Yet they have talks about mental health and meditation in the internal newsletter. 
- Even when you have excellent (internal) reviews and leave on good terms, managers here won't give you a reference letter that mentions their job title or anything to do with British Council. It's quite ridiculous.
- Most people seem to stay at their positions for a long time, it makes opportunities of career development not very wide and even rare for young talents.

job_title: Sales Staff in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: - Very support colleagues - Benefit is not bad - Quite clear procedure - Teachers & Management team have good knowledge, they’re not the stereotype backpackers. Learnt a lot
cons: - Slow pace. Very slow to catch up with the trend. - Takes long time for any big change to happen.

job_title: Exam Services Administrator in Ho Chi Minh City
pros: can delegate and learn how to manage project, planning and training invigilator
cons:
over time, over load, a lot of training and systems, low paid
pro active to master everything going smoothly
takes 2 months in advance to check your status after receiving an offer from employer

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
good benefits
flexible time
friendly managers
easy interview
cons: nothing to complain about here

review_title: Excellent Job Security. Good for Fresh graduates

pros: Good work-life balance. Non-toxic working environment.
cons: Weak management, bureaucratic. Lack company activities. Little career development.

review_title: Be wary, demand ALL in writing

cons: Management, induction, training- you will be lied to and then told you're making it up. You will be asked to break the law

job_title: Teacher in Ho Chi Minh City

review_title: I myself find the way to  gain good skills in dealing with children's matter, administration work  and customers.
job_title: Temporary Staff of Teaching Centre in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
English Environment: improve English, have chance to work with native spaeakers: exchange cuture and lifestyle, make friends with them
Good reputation
Have chance to push myself in the solving problem situation to make myself more responsible, skillful and hard-working.
work with many new, talented and sweet temporary staff when work in Teaching Centre Department.
cons:
not have many opportunities for my future career, means not chance to be promoted.
not support fully to fulfill my job: unclear guidance and still exist unfairness in tasks.
not have a good welfare although working for long time in the temporary staff. 
having a big gap, terrible treatment in allowances or any bonus in holidays

review_title: its a learning institution. change is a normal norm.
job_title: in South East Asia
pros: a respected brand. international org. opportunity to get involved in various projects and work with diverse people from different countries/cultures. you will never get bored!
cons: compensation is below market avarage. have to apply and compete for promotions. there is a huge gap re compensation package for UK staff and local staff (in other countries).

job_title: English Teacher in Ho Chi Minh City
pros:
One of the best salaries in Ho Chi Minh City
A lot of (paid) courses like TYLEC and DIP.
Sweet advantage packages for full-time employees
Great support from staff
Shared planning scheme saves a lot of planning time 
You usually always get two days off in a row
cons:
The winter term is sooooo long.
They are not very flexible as far as holidays and schedules

cons: Having to focus more and more on money making projects instead of arts ones - due to cuts.

review_title: British Council Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
job_title: Senior Teaching Assistant in Ho Chi Minh City

cons: Some staffs in other department (Marketing, Customer Management, Finance, etc.) are not friendly and sometime take the support they get for granted.

review_title: Good pay for a part-time job

- Good pay
